answers.answer: Hi!If you want to start birth control and you are overweight, and your cycles are irregular, then please consult a gynecologist to rule out hypothyroidism, polycystic ovary and diabetes. Adrenal gland problems and severe anemia are the other possibilities. Please discuss this with your mother and consult your doctor. Take care!
Birth control would help regulate your periods but I wouldn't really suggest that because it can cause hormone issues. Above all I think you should go see a doctor, especially a gynecologist

question: Every since I was younger like in 6th grade my cycle have been messing up I would come on two or three times out of a year. But now I'm a junior in high school which put me at 16. I stay on almost the hold month sometimes I spite through the hold month. I'm not sexual active but I am over weight. Do you think that have something to do with it? I'm so scared can u please help me out. I want to get on birth control but my mother do not want me to.THANKS!!!
title: my cycle
